Sequence Information.Peptide Name: CM2 (Ctriporin analog G4K,G8K, synthetic AMPs, UCLL1)
Sequence Information.Source: amino acid substitution, animal-derived, natural derivative

Literature.Author: Luo X, Deng H, Ding L, Ye X, Sun F, Qin C, Chen Z.2024
Literature.Title: Cationicity Enhancement on the Hydrophilic Face of Ctriporin Significantly Reduces Its Hemolytic Activity and Improves the Antimicrobial Activity against Antibiotic-Resistant ESKAPE Pathogens.

Sequence Information.Comments: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (89.47%) toCtriporinK: 21%, I=L: 16%, A=S: 11%.Activity: active against S. aureus ATCC29213 or ATCC25923 (MIC 1.9-3.7 uM), E. faecium ATCC29212 (MIC 1.9 uM), E. coli ATCC25922 or ATCC35218 (MIC 1.9-3.7 uM), P. aeruginosa ATCC27853 (MIC 7.4 uM), K. pneumoniae ATCC700603 (MIC 7.4 uM), A. baumannii ATCC19606 (MIC 1.9 uM).In vitro toxicity:  human RBC: HC50 ~120 ug/ml.Structure:  random coil in water and helical in 30 mM SDS micelles.
